Line 267: Line 267:
===The PageRank system===
===The PageRank system===
â
Google's central [[PageRank]] system has been criticized. Some, such as [[Daniel Brandt]], calling it "undemocratic". Common arguments are that the system is unfairly biased towards large web sites, and that the criteria for a page's importance are not subject to [[peer review]]. It must be stated in Googles defense that PageRank is a fully automated system which is impartial insofar as it knows no personal bias. As an automated system, it cannot really evaluate content. It remains unclear whether any process could assert the importance of a page in a way that would draw less criticism than the current PageRank system.
+
Google's central [[PageRank]] system has been criticized. Some, such as [[Daniel Brandt]], calling it "undemocratic". Common arguments are that the system is unfairly biased towards large web sites, and that the criteria for a page's importance are not subject to [[peer review]]. It must be stated in Google's defense that PageRank is a fully automated system which is impartial insofar as it knows no personal bias. As an automated system, it cannot really evaluate content. It remains unclear whether any process could assert the importance of a page in a way that would draw less criticism than the current PageRank system.
The system is also susceptible to manipulation and fraud through the use of dummy sites, an issue which does, however, plague all search engines. See [[Google bomb]] and [[Spamdexing]].
The system is also susceptible to manipulation and fraud through the use of dummy sites, an issue which does, however, plague all search engines. See [[Google bomb]] and [[Spamdexing]].
